column3: Greetings, traveler. You have nothing to fear here. That is assuming you bear us no ill will. Is there something you would ask of me?
What kind of place is this?
I keep watch for beasts and members of other tribes. Those that would do us harm. The previous Khorijin did the same; it only stands to reason I continue my duties in this life.
However, there is one thing I do not enjoy about this post. The Dawn Throne. I am forced to gaze upon it day in and day out. I was killed in a past life by the Oronir scum that dwell there.
This is a settlement we Dotharl built around a spring. Its waters provide both for us and the sheep we rear.
As you have doubtless noticed, water is scarce in the Nhaama Desert. Precisely why this is such a prized spot. We cannot relinquish it to the other tribes.
Not that I imagine any will be foolish enough to try and take it from us. Dotharl do not fear death. We are ever ready to do battle.
